title: 820-3437 - Does RTC reset over and over.
message:
Had liquid damage on C1910, which I replaced.

Could this be a faulty U1900?

It looks like an RTC reset that repeats ad nauseam.

title: 820-3437 - Does RTC reset over and over.
message:
Do you get variations at pin1?
It must be always high.
Remove U1900 and clean all that area and its pads; then resolder it.
Pin12 has stable clock?

title: 820-3437 - Does RTC reset over and over.
message:
U1900::1 is going up and down.

I'll replace it and report back.

title: 820-3437 - Does RTC reset over and over.
message: Be sure first if U1900 is correctly powered up...

title: 820-3437 - Does RTC reset over and over.
message:
Just noticed that PP3v3_S5 is power cycling.
Didn't pick up on it the first time I looked.

title: 820-3437 - Does RTC reset over and over.
message: if pp3v3_s5 is power cycling something up the line is shorted to ground.

title: 820-3437 - Does RTC reset over and over.
message: PPBUS even stable? 3v3_s5 pulsing could also be G2_EN pulsing. S5_pwrgd coming high?

title: 820-3437 - Does RTC reset over and over.
message:
PPBus is stable.

It seems to be boot every now and then, but mostly power cycles.
Will check G2_EN and S5_pwrgd in a moment.

title: 820-3437 - Does RTC reset over and over.
message:
S5_pwrgd is stable.

Ugh, G2_EN is cycling. But every five or ten powers I can get it stable, then it boots fine.

title: 820-3437 - Does RTC reset over and over.
message: SMC issue, probably crap under it.
